result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanith Husein

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tanith Husein in court.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Tanith Husein.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 and 3
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

The Court orders COUNTS 2 and 4 DISMISSED AND READ IN pursuant to negotiations.

The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OFF RECORD - Attorney Forrestal requesting adjournment. TAD evaluation scheduled for 10/10. No objection from the State. Case is adjourned. Parties notified.

Defendant Tanith Husein in court with attorney John J Forrestal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tanith Husein appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Discussion held regarding defendant's personal issues. Defense requests adjournment for reasons placed on the record.
Case adjourned.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tanith Husein in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Case to resolve by deferred prosecution agreement. Case adjourned back to Br 30.

Court ordered her not to keep any domestic animals or pets.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tanith Husein in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30..  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022@01:00PM
